title: Amazon to launch two Project Kuiper satellites on Vulcan’s first flight
summary: The first two satellites of Amazon’s Project Kuiper broadband constellation — Kuipersat-1 and Kuipersat-2 — will launch on the maiden flight of United Launch Alliance's new Vulcan Centaur rocket

title: NASA says the Artemis I mission will be ready to launch in one month
summary: Set your alarm for 7 minutes after midnight on November 14.

title: On space matters, Biden’s national security strategy adopts a less combative tone
summary: The White House on Oct. 12 released a long-delayed national security strategy that lays out challenges the United States faces in a tripolar world.

title: OneWeb unveils Innovation Challenge competition
summary: OneWeb is holding a competition for individuals, companies and academic organizations to propose applications for the London-based company’s low-Earth orbit satellite constellation.

title: Japan’s Epsilon fails after liftoff, destroying smallsat payload
summary: A Japanese Epsilon small launch vehicle failed to reach orbit during an Oct. 11 launch, resulting in the loss of all eight smallsats on board.

title: SpaceX announces a second private flight to the Moon aboard Starship
summary: "We can't force the timeline. It will happen when it happens."

title: NASA TV to Air Crew Activities as Astronauts Prepare, Return to Earth
summary: NASA will provide live coverage of the upcoming return activities for the agency’s SpaceX Crew-4 mission to the International Space Station.

title: Yahsat invests in direct-to-cell enabler eSAT Global
summary: Emirati fleet operator Yahsat said Oct. 11 it has invested in Californian startup eSAT Global, which is developing a chip that would enable phones to connect to its satellites in geostationary orbit.

title: Jumping on the direct-to-cell bandwagon
summary: More satellite operators are considering providing services directly to standard mobile phones following early product launches, big-name announcements, and progress startups are making for their dedicated constellations.

title: JAXA Epsilon fails on sixth flight carrying RAISE-3 and others
summary: Epsilon launched from the Mu Pad at the Uchinoura Space Center in Japan at 00:50 UTC on Oct. 12. This launch marked the sixth flight of JAXA’s Epsilon rocket, and the launch vehicle was to loft a rideshare mission into orbit consisting of RAISE-3 and numerous other satellites.
